detaileddescription.para: Anti-alignment for rings of concentric hatching to reduce visual ridges.
Maximum turning angle (in radians) for vertices that the resampling algorithm is allowed optimize out.
Add staggering to the resampling of parallel hatches, to reduce visual ridges. Recommanded range: (0,1)
Add staggering to the resampling of satin hatches, to reduce visual ridges. Recommanded range: (0,1)
Experimental resampling method for crosshatching, that tries un-align stitch placement.
Stroke density of perpendicular stroke caps / stroke joins.
When drawing text, optimize the stroke order of each character individually, instead of optimizing once for the whole sentece.
The constructor for PEmbroiderGraphics object.

parameterdescription.para: the running PApplet instance: in Processing, just pass the keyword 'this'

detaileddescription.para: Set the output file path. The filename should include the file type extension. Supported embroidery formats are: .DST, .EXP, .JEF, .PEC, .PES, .VP3, and .XXX. Additionally supported formats are: .PDF, .SVG, .TSV, and .GCODE.

parameterdescription.para: output file path. The format will be automatically inferred from the extension.

detaileddescription.para: Clear all current drawings.

Change fill color
r
red value, 0-255
g
green value, 0-255
b
blue value, 0-255
stroke

Change fill color
gray
grayscale value, 0-255
Disable filling shapes

Change stroke color
r
red value, 0-255
g
green value, 0-255
b
blue value, 0-255
fill

Change stroke color
gray
grayscale value 0-255
Disable outlining shapes

Change width of stroke
d
the stroke weight to use

Change stroke join (turning point) style
j
Same as Processing strokeJoin, this can be ROUND, MITER, BEVEL etc.
strokeCap

Change stroke cap (end point) style
j
Same as Processing strokeCap, this can be ROUND, SQUARE, PROJECT etc.
strokejoin
Modifies the location from which ellipses are drawn by changing the way in which parameters given to ellipse() are intepreted. also governs circle()

parameterdescription.para: Same as Processing ellipseMode, this can be RADIUS, CENTER, CORNER, CORNERS etc.

detaileddescription.para: Modifies the location from which rectangles are drawn by changing the way in which parameters given to rect() are intepreted.

parameterdescription.para: Same as Processing rectMode, this can be RADIUS, CENTER, CORNER, CORNERS etc.

detaileddescription.para: Change number of steps bezier curve is interpolated.

parameterdescription.para: The higher this number, the smoother the Bezier curve.

detaileddescription.para: Change hatching pattern

parameterdescription.para: This can be one of: PARALLEL, CROSS, CONCENTRIC, SPIRAL, PERLIN, VECFIELD, DRUNK

detaileddescription.para: Change outline drawing method

parameterdescription.para: This can be either PERPENDICULAR or TANGENT

detaileddescription.para: Change outline drawing method

parameterdescription.para: This can be either PERPENDICULAR or TANGENT
This can be one of COUNT (stroke weight used as line count), WEIGHT (honour stroke weight setting over spacing) or SPACING (honour spacing over stroke weight)

detaileddescription.para: Set the position of the stroke, relative to the shape's edge
Set the position of the stroke, relative to the shape's edge

parameterdescription.para: This can be one of CENTER, INSIDE, or OUTSIDE

detaileddescription.para: Change angle of parallel hatch lines
Change angles of parallel and cross hatching lines

parameterdescription.para: the angle from +x in radians (for parallel hatches and the first direction of cross hatching)
the angle from +x in radians (for second direction of cross hatching)

detaileddescription.para: Change angle of parallel hatch lines
Change angles of parallel and cross hatching lines

parameterdescription.para: the angle from +x in degrees (for parallel hatches and the first direction of cross hatching)
the angle from +x in degrees (for second direction of cross hatching)

detaileddescription.para:
Sets the orientation of the stitches within a stroke
ang
the angle (in radians)

Sets the orientation of the stitches within a stroke
ang
the angle (in degrees)
Changes the spacing between hatching lines: a.k.a sparsity or inverse-density
Changes the spacing between stroke lines: a.k.a sparsity or inverse-density
Changes the scaling for perlin noise hatching
Switches the algorithms used to compute the drawing

parameterdescription.para: one of ADAPTIVE (use most appropriate method for each situation according to Lingdong) FORCE_VECTOR (uses vector math whenever possible) FORCE_RASTER (first render shapes as raster and re-extract the structures, generally more robust)

detaileddescription.para: Set the vector field used for vector field hatching

parameterdescription.para: a vector field defination simple, just a class with a get(x,y) method

detaileddescription.para: Set the desirable stitch length. Stitches will try their best to be around this length, but actual length will vary slightly for best result
Set the minimum stitch length. Drawings with higher precision than this will be resampled down to have at least this stitch length
Set stitch properties

parameterdescription.para: resample noise to avoid alignment patterns; must be in the range [0...1]

detaileddescription.para: Set render order: render strokes over fill, or other way around?

parameterdescription.para: This can either be STROKE_OVER_FILL or FILL_OVER_STROKE

detaileddescription.para: Turn resampling on and off. For embroidery machines, you might want it; for plotters you probably won't need it.

parameterdescription.para: true for on, false for off

detaileddescription.para: Sets whether SPIRAL hatching proceeds clockwise or counterclockwise

parameterdescription.para: This can be CLOCKWISE or COUNTERCLOCKWISE. CW and CCW are also permissible.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the file exporting behavior if a stitch was placed out of bounds.

parameterdescription.para: This can be one of WARN, CROP, IGNORE, ASK, or ABORT

detaileddescription.para: Sets how the SATIN hatching mode operates.

parameterdescription.para: This can be one of ZIGZAG, SIGSAG, or BOUSTROPHEDON

detaileddescription.para: Averages a bunch of points

simplesect.para: a vector holding the average value

detaileddescription.para: Averages a bunch of bunches of points

parameterdescription.para: a bunch of bunches of points

literally pass in whatever. It is necessary because of type erasure in Java, which basically means Java cannot tell the difference between List<T> and List<List<T>> in arguments, so a difference in number of arguments is required for overloading to work

simplesect.para: a vector holding the average value

memberdef.argsstring: (PVector p0, PVector p1, ArrayList< PVector > poly)
memberdef.name: segmentIntersectPolygon

detaileddescription.para: Find intersection between a segment and a polygon. Intersections returned are sorted from one endpoint of the segment to the other endpoint

simplesect.para: a list of vectors holding the intersection points sorted from one endpoint to the other

memberdef.argsstring: (PVector p0, PVector p1, ArrayList< ArrayList< PVector >> polys)
memberdef.name: segmentIntersectPolygons

detaileddescription.para: Find intersection between a segment and several polygons. Intersections returned are sorted from one endpoint of the segment to the other endpoint

simplesect.para: a list of vectors holding the intersection points sorted from one endpoint to the other

memberdef.argsstring: (PVector p, ArrayList< PVector > poly, int trials)
memberdef.name: pointInPolygon

detaileddescription.para: Check if a point is inside a polygon.

parameterdescription.para: try a couple times to be sure, otherwise we might encounter degenerate cases

simplesect.para: true means inside, false means outside

detaileddescription.para: Check if a point is inside a polygon. Dumbed down version of pointinPolygon(3) where I pick the number of trials for you

simplesect.para: true means inside, false means outside

detaileddescription.para: Generate a random point that is inside a polygon

parameterdescription.para: number of times we try before giving up

simplesect.para: either null or a point inside the polygon. If it is null, it either means the polygon has zero or almost zero area, or that the number of trials specified is not large enough to find one

detaileddescription.para: Generate a random point that is inside a polygon Dumbed down version of randomPointInPolygon(2) where I pick the number of trials for you

simplesect.para: either null or a point inside the polygon. If it is null, it either means the polygon has zero or almost zero area, or that the default number of trials is not large enough to find one

memberdef.argsstring: (ArrayList< PVector > poly, int color, float resampleRandomizeOffset)
memberdef.name: pushPolyline

detaileddescription.para: Add a polyline to the global array of all polylines drawn Applying transformation matrices and resampling All shape drawing routines go through this function for finalization

parameterdescription.para: whether to add a random offset during resample step to prevent alignment patterns

detaileddescription.para:
Simplified version for pushPolyline(3) where resampleRandomizeOffset is set to false
poly
a polyline
color
the color of the polyline (0xRRGGBB)

offset a polyline by certain amount (for outlining strokes, naive implementation)
poly
a polyline
d
offset amount, positive/negative for inward/outward

Turn a self-intersecting polygon to a list of non-self-intersecting polygons
poly
a polygon

Check the winding orientation of polygon, clockwise or anti-clockwise
poly
a polygon
whether the polygon is positively oriented

Calculate distance between point and line
p
the point in question
p0
a point on the line
p1
a different point on the line
distance from point to line

Inset a polygon (making it slightly smaller fitting in the original polygon) Inverse of offsetPolygon, alias for offsetPolygon(poly, -d);
poly
the polygon
d
the amount of inset
a list of polygons. When the given polygon is big at both ends and small in the middle, the inset might break into multiple polygons

Offset a polygon (making it slightly smaller fitting in the original polygon, or slightly bigger wrapping the original polygon)
poly
the polygon
d
the amount of offset. Use negative value for insetting
a list of polygons. When the given polygon is big at both ends and small in the middle, the inset might break into multiple polygons

When the general shapes of two polygons are similar, this function finds the index offset of vertices for the first polygon so that the vertices best match those of the second polygon with one-to-one correspondence. The number of vertices needs to be the same for the polygons
poly0
the first polygon
poly1
the second polygon
the optimal index offset

memberdef.argsstring: (ArrayList< PVector > poly, float minLen, float maxLen, float randomize, float randomizeOffset)
memberdef.name: resample

detaileddescription.para:
Resample a polyline to make it stitchable
poly
the polyline
minLen
minimum length of each segment, segment shorter than this will be downsampled
maxLen
maximum length of each segment (not counting the randomization added on top, specified by randomize)
randomize
amount of randomization in stitch length to avoid alignment patterns. 0 for none
randomizeOffset
amount of randomization to add to the offset of the first stitch in every polyline. 0 for none
the resampled polyline

Resample a polyline to make it have N vertices. Can be an upsample or a downsample. Each resultant segment will be the same length, +/- floating point percision errors
poly
the polyline
n
the desired number of vertices
the resampled polyline

Resample a polyline to make it have N vertices, while keeping important turning points. Can be an upsample or a downsample. Each resultant segment have approximately same length, but compromising to the preserving of corners
poly
the polyline
n
the desired number of vertices
the resampled polyline

memberdef.name: resampleCrossIntersection

polys
the polylines
angle
the angle of the original polylines
spacing
the spacing of the original polylines
len
the desired length of each segment after resampling
the resampled polylines

memberdef.argsstring: (boolean color, boolean stitches, boolean route, int nStitches)
memberdef.name: visualize

detaileddescription.para:
Visualize the current design on the main Processing canvas
color
whether to visualize color, if false, will use random colors; if stitches argument is true, this will have no effect and black will always be used for visibility
stitches
whether to visualize stitches, i.e. little dots on end of segments
route
whether to visualize the path between polylines that will be taken by embroidery machine/plotter. To be able to not see a mess when enabling this option, try optimize()
Visualize the current design on the main Processing canvas, using default set of options
Supposed to initialize something, but as we currently don't need to, this is a NOP
Save the drawing to file

Half the number of vertices in the polyline by joining every two segments

amount of turning for a vertex to be considered important

memberdef.name: image

memberdef.argsstring: (PShape sh, int x, int y, int w, int h)
memberdef.name: shape

memberdef.argsstring: (PImage mask, float d, float perlinScale, float deltaX, int minVertices, int maxVertices, int maxIter)
memberdef.name: perlinField

detaileddescription.para:
Hatch an image using perlin noise fill
mask
a binary image/graphics, white means on, black means off
d
spacing between strokes
perlinScale
perlin noise scale
deltaX
step size of the walk in vector field
minVertices
strokes with too few segments (those tiny ones) will be discarded
maxVertices
maximum number of vertices for each stroke
maxIter
maximum number of iterations (i.e. seeds to begin walking from). if the shape of polygon is weird, more seeds is needed to reach all the corners

memberdef.argsstring: (PImage mask, VectorField vf, float d, int minVertices, int maxVertices, int maxIter)
memberdef.name: customField

detaileddescription.para:
Hatch an image using custom vector field fill
mask
a binary image/graphics, white means on, black means off
d
spacing between strokes
minVertices
strokes with too few segments (those tiny ones) will be discarded
maxVertices
maximum number of vertices for each stroke
maxIter
maximum number of iterations (i.e. seeds to begin walking from). if the shape of polygon is weird, more seeds is needed to reach all the corners

memberdef.argsstring: (PImage mask, float ang, float d, float step)
memberdef.name: hatchParallelRaster

detaileddescription.para:
Hatch an image using PARALLEL fill (with raster algorithms)
mask
a binary image/graphics, white means on, black means off
ang
angle of parallel lines in radians
d
spacing between strokes
step
step size, smaller the more accurate
the hatching as a list of polylines

Lerp a number around 360 degrees, meaning lerp360(358,2) gives 0 instead of 180 Useful for lerping hues and angles
h0
the first number
h1
the second number
t
the interpolation parameter
the lerped number

memberdef.argsstring: (ArrayList< PVector > poly, float w, int n)

Smoothen a polyline with rational quadratic bezier (thus upsampling)
poly
the polyline
w
weight of the rational bezier, higher the pointier
n
number of segments for each segment on the polyline
the smoothed polyline

memberdef.argsstring: (ArrayList< ArrayList< PVector >> polys, int w, int h)
memberdef.name: perfectDistanceTransform

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the accurate distance transform by actually mesuring distances (slow). See PEmbroiderTrace for the fast approximation
polys
the polylines to consider
w
width of the output image
n
height of the output image
the distance transform stored in row-major array of floats

Clip polylines with a mask
polys
the polylines to consider
mask
a mask, black means off, white means on

Compute isolines for a grayscale image using findContours on multiple thresholds.
im
the input grayscale image
d
luminance distance between adjacent thresholds
an array of isolines as polylines

Check if a polygon completely contains another
poly0
the polygon that is supposed to contain the other one
poly1
the polygon that is supposed to be contained by the other one
true for containment, false for not

Compute area of polygon
poly
the polygon
the area

Run TSP on polylines in the current design to optimize for connective path length
trials
number of trials. the more times you try, the higher chance you'll get a better result
maxIter
maximum number of iterations to run 2-Opt.
Simplified version of optimize(2) where the trial and maxIter is picked for you

Begin a block of stitch order optimization (TSP solver), to be paired with endOptimize()
reorderColor
number of seconds to try to reorder color to reduce number of color changes without modifying the final look of the design, 0 means no color reordering
trials
number of trials to run the TSP
maxIter
number of iterations for each trial of TSP
Same as beginOptimize(3) with default parameters
Close a beginOptimize() block.

Change horizontal alignment of text
align
alignment mode, one of LEFT, CETER, RIGHT

Change horizontal and vertical alignment of text
halign
horizontal alignment mode, one of LEFT, CETER, RIGHT
valign
vertical alignment mode, one of TOP, CENTER, BASELINE, BOTTOM

Change size of text
size
the desired size of text

Change font of text. Notice this function is overloaded with one version for PFont and one for hershey font, with identical API This one is for the hershey font
font
the desired hershey font

Change font of text. Notice this function is overloaded with one version for PFont and one for hershey font, with identical API This one is for PFont
font
the desired PFont

Draw some text
str
the string containing the text to be drawn
x
x coordinate, meaning of which depends on textAlign
y
y coordinate, meaning of which depends on textAlign
Compute the determinant of a 3x3 matrix as 3 row vectors.

memberdef.name: segmentIntersect3D

detaileddescription.para: Intersect two segments in 3D, returns lerp params instead of actual points, because the latter can cheaply be derived from the former; more expensive the other way around. Also works for 2D.

simplesect.para: vec where vec.x is the lerp param for first segment, and vec.y is the lerp param for the second segment

detaileddescription.para:
Calculate distance between point and a segment (when projection is not on the line, the distance becomes that to one of the endpoints)
p
the point in question
p0
first endpoint of the segment
p1
second endpoint of the segment
distance from point to segment

Deep clone any object
object
some object @reutrn the clone

rx

ry

memberdef.name: reorderColorMonteCarlo

detaileddescription.para: This is a template class and can be used to start a new processing Library. Make sure you rename this class as well as the name of the example package 'template' to your own Library naming convention.
(the tag example followed by the name of an example included in folder 'examples' will automatically include the example in the javadoc.)
